body.p:
Franklin Simpson County
Ky May 4th 1864
To his Exencely
Thos E Bramlett
Governor of Kentucky

Sir I address you in behalf of John W Roby and his Son Ezra Roby Citizens of Simpson County who were fined in our Criminal Court one $100, the other $50- the onely witness to prove the charge was the Depty Sheriff himself I was a Lookeron in court when the trial took place and I am clearly of the opinion that it is Such a case as calls for Executive clemency I am by no meanes an advocate for violators of our laws but witnessing the manner of the witness deposing and Suing the great feeling exhibited by him in connection of ^with^ the facts of the case I am clearly of the opinion the Jury Ered the old man has been unfortunate and is much involved his wife is old and helpless and the young man without meanes and in verry poor health If your Exencely careful Justified in remitting the portion of the fines going to the State it and ^will be^ out of charity
